To jump, or not to jump?\nThat is the question:

Whether to lie idle and envy,
or soar to new heights for but a brief instant..

only to be reminded once more of the harsh
nature of the world.

These dreams have haunted man
since his ability to sleep.

For what do we possess?- The ability to capture and
thieve a winged beasts gifts?

To mechanize the skies?

Blasphemy, I say. Our jealousy
only serves to exhibit our hubris.

Our vanity.
Our desire to so desperately be something
we are not.

Not all creatures are born with
the ability to fly, and your destiny

was already in place the moment
you were conceived.

<The rambling continues on.>

<You decide against reading more
and skip to the next chapter.>

When I was but a boy,
I became fascinated with motion.

The motion of the world, the people,
and the creatures around us.

Societys intermingled intricacies
moving past you, every
moment of every day.
Thus made me question:\nWhat does it mean to be in motion?

The strictest definition is, of course,
any force which propels your body.

Yet this fails to encompass the
feeling of moving forward.

The intangible states of progression
and stricture.

My mind was wracked.

My desires propelled towards understanding
the flow around me,

for how are you to understand motion,
if not experiencing it?

<The author's self-reflection continues on.>

<You decide against reading more
and skip to the first interesting title.>
